page.title: 14WATER AND SEWAGE.
page.content: Harlestone,Church Brampton and Althorp are served by mains water supply.Many springs and wells have existed and still do. The sewerage works near Church Brampton was taken out of commission in 1981 and most of the site sold.A small pumping station remains to pump Harlestone waste to a further station serving Church Brampton and another village. There are artificial ponds in Althorp Park and a large artificial lake in Harlestone.The bottom is of concrete but it is much shallower now due to silting.Fed by a spring the outflow is under an eight arched bridge.This outflow feeds the old mill stream. An ornamental animal drinking trough at Harlestone was erected by the fifth Earl Spencer commemorating his wife.
